2021.expert_review:
What Is the 2021 Cadillac CT4?

The 2021 Cadillac CT4 is an entry-luxury sports sedan with room for five. It’s powered by a standard 237-horsepower, turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine or an optional turbo 2.7-liter four-cylinder that makes 310 hp in the Premium Luxury trim level and 325 hp in the V-Series. Rear- and all-wheel-drive models are available, and competitors include the Lexus IS and Infiniti Q50. 

What’s New on the 2021 Cadillac CT4?

Wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto are now standard, and a new 12-inch digital instrument panel is available on select trim levels. The latest generation of Cadillac’s Super Cruise hands-free driver-assist system is also available, as well as a new Diamond Sky Special Edition with unique exterior and interior styling cues.   

What Features in the 2021 Cadillac CT4 Are Most Important?

Standard features include:

LED headlights 
Remote start 
8-inch touchscreen multimedia system
4G LTE Wi-Fi hot spot (data subscription required after trial)
Automatic emergency braking

Available features include:

Leather-trimmed seats
Heated and ventilated front seats
Heated steering wheel
Bose premium stereo
Wireless device charging
Navigation
Head-up display
360-degree camera system
Blind spot warning with rear cross-traffic alert
Lane-keep assist
Adaptive cruise control
Should I Buy the 2021 Cadillac CT4?

For luxury buyers interested in a performance-oriented small sedan, the Cadillac CT4 is worth considering. The V-Series model has a great engine and impressive ride and handling balance. It’s small inside, however, and getting in and out can be difficult.

Notable features: Wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto now standard
Hands-free Super Cruise driver-assist system available

2022.expert_review:
What Is the 2022 Cadillac CT4?

The Cadillac CT4 is an entry-luxury sports sedan with room for five. It’s powered by a standard 237-horsepower, turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine paired with an eight-speed automatic transmission. A turbo 2.7-liter four-cylinder that makes 310 hp in the Premium Luxury trim level and 325 hp in the V-Series model is available. This engine works with a 10-speed automatic. Rear- and all-wheel-drive models are offered, and competitors include the Lexus IS and Infiniti Q50. The CT4-V has 13.7 cubic feet of trunk space, according to Cars.com’s cargo measurements.

What’s New on the 2022 Cadillac CT4?

A new high-performance CT4-V Blackwing that’s powered by a 472-hp, twin-turbocharged 3.6-liter V-6 engine joins the CT4 model range. 

What Features in the 2022 Cadillac CT4 Are Most Important?

Standard features include:

LED headlights 
Remote start 
8-inch touchscreen multimedia system
Wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto smartphone connectivity
Wireless device charging
Forward collision warning
Automatic emergency braking

Available features include:

Leather-trimmed seats
Heated and ventilated front seats
Heated steering wheel
12-inch digital instrument panel
Bose premium stereo
Navigation
360-degree camera system
Blind spot warning with rear cross-traffic alert
Lane-keeping assist
Adaptive cruise control
Rear automatic braking
Super Cruise hands-free driver-assist system
Should I Buy the 2022 Cadillac CT4?

For luxury buyers interested in a performance-oriented small sedan, the Cadillac CT4 is worth considering. The V-Series model has a great engine and impressive ride and handling balance. It’s small inside, however, and getting in and out can be difficult.

Notable features: Wireless Apple CarPlay, Android Auto standard
Super Cruise hands-free driver-assist system available

2023.expert_review:
The Cadillac CT4 blends luxury with state of the art performance and competes with rival sedans like the Alfa Romeo Giulia, Audi A4, BMW 3 Series and Mercedes-Benz C-Class. The GM luxury brand is leaving the CT4’s formula largely unaltered for the 2023 model year, with the only changes being new exterior colors and a starting price of $35,790 (all pricing includes $1,395 destination charge).

Related: Cadillac Gears Up to Add Manual Transmission to CT4, CT5 Blackwings

New Colors Paint Largely Carried-Over Picture

The CT4’s lone major update for 2023 is the addition of three new extra-cost exterior colors: Radiant Red Tintcoat, Argent Silver Metallic and Midnight Steel Metallic. The range-topping CT4-V Blackwing adds a fourth hue called Maverick Noir Frost that’s exclusive to the Sebring IMSA Edition. The Blackwing will also get a late-availability Blackwing badge on its trunk.

Otherwise, powertrains are the same: Luxury and Sport trims continue to be powered by a turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine that makes 237 horsepower; the Premium Luxury trim has an optional 310-hp, turbo 2.7-liter four-cylinder; the V-Series also uses the turbo 2.7-liter, but power is bumped up to 325 hp; and the CT4-V Blackwing gets a 472-hp, twin-turbo 3.6-liter V-6. An eight-speed automatic transmission is standard on the 2.0-liter, the 2.7-liter gets a 10-speed automatic, and the Blackwing gets either a six-speed manual or the 10-speed automatic.

Pricing and Release Date

The 2023 CT4 is available now. Full pricing is below:

Luxury: $35,790
Premium Luxury 2.0: $40,690
Premium Luxury 2.7: $45,790
Sport: $41,890
V-Series: $47,990
V-Series Blackwing: $61,890

Rear-wheel drive is standard, while all-wheel drive adds $2,000 to the CT4’s price and $500 to the V-Series (it remains unavailable with the Blackwing). The automatic transmission is an extra $3,175 on the CT4-V Blackwing.

2025.expert_review:
What Is the 2025 Cadillac CT4?

The Cadillac CT4 is a small luxury sedan that comes standard with a 237-horsepower, turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine paired with an eight-speed automatic transmission. One rung higher is a turbocharged 2.7-liter four-cylinder that comes with a 10-speed automatic. This powertrain develops 310 hp in Premium Luxury trim or 325 hp in the sportier CT4-V. Sitting atop the range is the high-performance CT4-V Blackwing, which boasts a 472-hp, twin-turbo 3.6-liter V-6 and can be had with the 10-speed automatic or a six-speed manual gearbox. The Blackwing comes only with rear-wheel drive, but other CT4s are available with RWD or all-wheel drive. According to Cars.com’s cargo measurements, the CT4-V has 13.7 cubic feet of trunk volume. Click here to learn how compatible Cadillac’s smallest sedan is with car seats. The CT4’s competitors include the Alfa Romeo Giulia, BMW 3 Series, Genesis G70 and Lexus IS. 

What’s New on the 2025 Cadillac CT4?

The CT4 family sees minor detail changes for 2025, and the CT4-V Blackwing gains a limited-production Petit Pataud edition that pays homage to a 1950 Cadillac that raced at Le Mans. 

What Features in the 2025 Cadillac CT4 Are Most Important?

Standard features include:

8-inch touchscreen 
Wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto smartphone connectivity
Wireless device charging
Two USB ports
Satellite radio
Wi-Fi hot spot
Power-adjustable front seats
Blind spot warning
Rear cross-traffic alert
Rear-seat reminder
Teen Driver vehicle settings

Available features include:

Leather seating surfaces
Heated and ventilated front seats
Heated steering wheel
12-inch digital instrument panel
Bose audio system
Navigation
360-degree camera system
Adaptive cruise control
Rear automatic braking
Super Cruise hands-free driver-assist system
Should I Buy the 2025 Cadillac CT4?

The Cadillac CT4 is agile and entertaining to drive, particularly with the potent engines in the CT4-V and CT4-V Blackwing. From behind the wheel, it’s clear Cadillac wanted to create a small luxury car that emphasized performance. Downsides include a small trunk and cramped backseat. However, if you travel light and are looking for an athletic, value-packed small luxury sedan, the handsome CT4 is worth consideration.

Notable features: High-performance CT4-V Blackwing with twin-turbo V-6
Super Cruise hands-free driver-assist system available

2026.expert_review:
Cadillac is busy pumping out new, bigger and faster electric SUVs, so the brand’s entry-level sedan receives little love this year. Rolling into its seventh model year, the CT4 is unchanged for 2026 but still offers a variety of powertrain configurations at a base price that undercuts most of its competitors. The 2026 Cadillac CT4 starts at $37,095 (all prices include the $1,495 destination charge).
Related: Which New Cars Have Manual Transmissions?
Release Date and Pricing
The 2026 Cadillac CT4 is on sale now. Full line pricing is as follows:

Luxury: $37,095
Premium Luxury: $41,395
Sport: $45,295
V-Series: $51,495
V-Series Blackwing: $64,195


  
    
  
    What Are the 2026 Cadillac CT4’s Trim Levels?
The base Luxury trim features 17-inch wheels, LED exterior lighting, and keyless entry and start. Its cabin is upholstered in synthetic leather and outfitted with heated and power-adjustable front seats, a heated steering wheel, dual-zone automatic climate control, wireless phone charging, eight speakers, and an 8-inch infotainment touchscreen with wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto.
Upgrading to the Premium Luxury nets 18-inch wheels, rain-sensing windshield wipers, genuine leather and upgraded front seats with ventilation. The Sport trim gets a unique front bumper, an integrated rear spoiler, black exterior trim, adjustable thigh support for the front seats and aluminum pedals.
The CT4 V-Series gets a high-performance overhaul consisting of adaptive dampers (on rear-drive models), a limited-slip rear differential, Brembo front brakes and GM’s Performance Traction Management graduated stability control with launch control. It also boasts a 14-speaker Bose sound system.
Building off the V-Series, the Blackwing packs yet more power, an upgraded limited-slip differential, Brembo front and rear brakes, and a unique front bumper with ground effects. It switches to a 15-speaker AKG audio system and adds navigation and a 12-inch digital instrument cluster.
Standard and Available Safety Features
Standard safety tech across the 2026 CT4 lineup includes forward collision warning with pedestrian detection, automatic emergency braking, blind spot monitors, rear cross-traffic alert, lane departure warning, lane departure steering assist, a following distance indicator, automatic high beams and rear parking sensors. The Premium Luxury trim level adds adaptive cruise control, front parking sensors and reverse automatic braking. A head-up display, GM’s Super Cruise hands-free highway driving tech and a 360-degree parking camera are optional from the Premium Luxury on up.

What Are the 2026 Cadillac CT4’s Powertrain Specs and MPG?
The CT4’s base engine is a 237-horsepower, turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder with 258 pounds-feet of torque. It is mated to an eight-speed automatic transmission. A turbocharged 2.7-liter four-cylinder is available on the Premium Luxury trim level for $4,950; it makes 310 hp and 350 pounds-feet and is mated to a 10-speed automatic transmission.
Rear-wheel drive is standard, and all-wheel drive is a $2,000 option. Cadillac says the 2.0-liter CT4 returns an EPA-rated 22/32/26 mpg city/highway/combined with RWD and 21/31/25 mpg with AWD (official ratings for the 2026 model are not yet available). The 2.7-liter is rated at 21/31/25 mpg with rear-drive and 21/29/24 mpg with AWD.
The CT4 V-Series also packs the turbocharged 2.7-liter four, but here it generates 325 hp and 380 pounds-feet of torque. The 10-speed automatic and rear-drive are again standard, but AWD costs only $500 on the V. It returns 20/29/23 mpg with RWD and 20/28/23 with AWD.
Cadillac reserves the Blackwing badge for its hardest-core performance models, and in the CT4, that means a twin-turbocharged 3.6-liter V-6 churning out an impressive 472 hp and 445 pounds-feet paired to a standard six-speed manual transmission. There’s no AWD offered on the Blackwing, but the 10-speed automatic is available for $3,175. With the stick shift, the Blackwing is rated at 15/23/18 mpg; the automatic increases those figures to 16/24/19 mpg.

2024.expert_review:
What Is the 2024 Cadillac CT4?
The Cadillac CT4 is a luxury sports sedan that comes standard with a 237-horsepower, turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine paired with an eight-speed automatic transmission. One rung higher is a turbocharged 2.7-liter four-cylinder that comes with a 10-speed automatic; this powertrain develops 310 hp in Premium Luxury trim or 325 hp in the sportier CT4-V. Sitting atop the range is the high-performance CT4-V Blackwing, which boasts a 472-hp, twin-turbo 3.6-liter V-6 and can be had with the 10-speed automatic or a six-speed manual gearbox. The Blackwing comes only with rear-wheel drive, but other CT4s are available with RWD or all-wheel drive.
According to Cars.com’s cargo measurements, the CT4-V has 13.7 cubic feet of trunk volume. Read here to learn how compatible Cadillac’s smallest sedan is with car seats. The CT4’s competitors include the BMW 3 Series, Genesis G70 and Lexus IS.
What’s New on the 2024 Cadillac CT4?
The only notable update to the 2024 Cadillac CT4 lineup is the addition of 20th-anniversary cosmetic tweaks to the CT4-V and Blackwing variants. These celebrate two decades of Cadillac’s performance-minded V sub-brand and include small 20th Anniversary exterior badges, along with four new colors: Velocity Red, Cyber Yellow, Coastal Blue and Black Diamond.   
What Features in the 2024 Cadillac CT4 Are Most Important?
Standard features include:

8-inch touchscreen 
Wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto smartphone connectivity
Wireless device charging
Two USB ports
Satellite radio
Wi-Fi hot spot
Power-adjustable driver and front passenger seats
Blind spot warning
Rear cross-traffic alert
Rear-seat reminder
Teen Driver vehicle settings

Available features include:

Leather seating surfaces
Heated and ventilated front seats
Heated steering wheel
12-inch digital instrument panel
Bose audio system
Navigation
360-degree camera system
Adaptive cruise control
Rear automatic braking
Super Cruise hands-free driver-assist system

Should I Buy the 2024 Cadillac CT4?
The 2024 Cadillac CT4 is agile and entertaining to drive, particularly with the potent engines in the CT4-V and CT4-V Blackwing. From behind the wheel, it’s clear Cadillac wanted to create a small luxury car that emphasized performance. Downsides include a small trunk and cramped backseat. However, if you travel light and are looking for an athletic, value-packed small luxury sedan, the handsome CT4 is worth consideration.

Notable features: High-performance CT4-V Blackwing with twin-turbo V-6
Super Cruise hands-free driver-assist system available

2020.expert_review:
Competes with: BMW 3 Series, Audi A4, Mercedes-Benz C-Class, Lexus IS
Looks like: Cadillac’s flagship CT6 sedan scaled down
Powertrain: A 237-horsepower, turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder or 309-hp, turbocharged 2.7-liter four-cylinder engine mated to either an eight- or 10-speed automatic transmission; rear- or all-wheel drive
Hits dealerships: March
The 2020 Cadillac CT4 is the new entry-level sedan from GM’s luxury brand, and it replaces the discontinued ATS in the Caddy lineup. In addition to the performance-oriented CT4-V, the CT4 will offer Luxury, Premium Luxury and Sport trim levels. Cadillac also announced that its Super Cruise hands-free driving system, which is being expanded to more roads, will become available on the CT4 in 2020.
Related: 2020 Cadillac CT4-V: Less Performance, More Affordable

  
    
  
    Exterior
Cadillac says the CT4 is a bit bigger than the ATS, and its overall softer lines — particularly in the non-V models — and fastback profile echo Cadillac’s big CT6 sedan a little more than the new 2020 CT5.
The grille and exterior trim in bright finish distinguish the CT4 Luxury and Premium Luxury trim levels, while the Sport trim level offers the darkened trim and grille as well as some of the more aggressive bumper and trim design aspects of the V model (as well as its Brembo front brakes) in a lower-performance version.
Interior
The CT4 cabin features an 8-inch touchscreen powered by GM’s latest operating system. Standard features include keyless entry and push-button start, a leather-wrapped steering wheel (heated optional), color dual-display driver information center, LED interior lighting and premium audio with active noise cancellation.
More From Cars.com:

R.I.P. Cadillac ATS: Another Sedan Pops Its Clogs
2020 Cadillac CT5: If Anyone Still Wants a Sports Sedan, Enjoy
2019 Cadillac XT4 Review: A Tidy Newbie with Teething Pains
Cadillac CT6 on GM’s Do-Not-Discard List After All
2020 Cadillac XT6 First Drive: No Alarms and No Surprises

Under the Hood
The CT4’s base engine is a turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder putting out 237 horsepower and 258 pounds-feet of torque. It works with an eight-speed automatic transmission. That’s down from 272 hp for the base 2.0-liter in the outgoing ATS. A turbocharged 2.7-liter four-cylinder that also goes in the V model is available. It’s an option for the Premium Luxury trim level, but in a detuned version putting out 309 hp and 348 pounds-feet of torque versus 325 hp and 380 pounds-feet of torque in the CT4-V. This engine teams with a 10-speed automatic.
Rear-wheel drive is standard; all-wheel drive is offered on all models. All models also offer selectable drive modes that, depending on equipment, can alter settings for shifting, suspension, steering and brake feel, AWD front and rear torque split, and exhaust note. The modes include Tour, Sport, Snow/Ice, Track and a personal mode; the V gets an additional performance V Mode.
Safety
Available active safety features include forward collision warning, automatic emergency braking, front pedestrian braking, blind spot warning, rear cross-traffic alert, adaptive cruise control, lane departure warning, lane-keeping assist, reverse automatic braking, automatic high-beam headlights and GM’s Safety Alert Seat.
